page.title: 16Stockgrove Park & Shire Oak.
page.content: In{Stockgrove Park}most of the trees are Deciduous such as Oak, Ash, Beech, etc. There are quite a lot of conifers as well. There is a lake there with a stream flowing to Stockgrove Park lake.{Shire Oak}was a big tree in the middle of Map Ref.91,28. It was used for separating the boundaries between Buckinghamshire and Bedfordshire and in the past it was used as a meeting place for local grievances. On the 24th-27th May 1985 the Shire Oak was blown down in a gale.The animals that live in the woodland are Grey Squirrels,Rabbits,Deer,Fox,Mice,Woodpe cker,Owl and other birds.There are lots of Fox and Rabbit holes. The ground is mostly hilly but some is flat. Most of the ground is covered with bracken and different kinds of grasses.
